name: Transnational Alliance to Combat Illicit Trade
legal: non-governmental, not-for-profit organisation under US tax code 501(c)(6)
membership: TRACIT is not a member to any body.
goal: The Transnational Alliance to Combat Illicit Trade (TRACIT) is an independent, business-led initiative to mitigate the economic and social damages of illicit trade by strengthening government enforcement mechanisms and integrating supply chain controls across industry sectors.
interests: Consumers, Food Safety, Fraud prevention, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Trade
euInitiatives:
On 7 May 2018, TRACIT will be launching in Brussels an Illicit Trade Environmental Index. The initiative has been developed in partnership with The Economist Group.

For this event, TRACIT is seeking the participation as of EU officials as panelists. These officials will be asked to provide their perspective on illicit trade in the context of the findings of the Index.
